snippet: As Angela Merkel and American officials disagree over supplying weapons to Ukraine, John Kerry says “there is no split.”
abstract: Serge Schmemann Editorial Observer explores scene at Munich Security Conference, where European and American leaders discussed issue of how best to help Ukraine counter Russia's aid to rebels; notes German Chancellor Angela Merkel, who prefers negotiation over military aid, urged United States not to supply Ukraine with lethal arms; says what was most remarkable was consensus that Russia's actions in Ukraine are unacceptable.
lead_paragraph: As Angela Merkel and American officials disagree over supplying weapons to Ukraine, John Kerry says “there is no split.”

headline.print_headline: European Leaders Debate Aid to Ukraine, but Not Russia’s Transgressions
headline.main: European Leaders Debate Aid to Ukraine, but Not Russia’s Transgressions
